intro: Gongronemopsis, commonly known as the orchid vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their climbing habit and showy, often fragrant flowers. They are native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrive in humid, shaded environments. Gongronemopsis species typically have elongated stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Their flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and can exhibit a range of colors, including white, yellow, and pink.
